reviewText: Too close to the truth for me. It was as I recalled, street angel and house devil. I think this film should be mandatory for young women who are entering into a potentially difficult relationship.Well acted, very realistic

reviewText: This is a movie based on the book by Charlotte Fedders, a battered woman married to a very high-ranking official in a presidential administration.  The movie depicts their first meeting, the clues about him that she decided to ignore, and the outcome of his abuse on her children.  Her final break from him should inspire anyone who feels trapped in an unhealthy relationship!
summary: True Story of Inspiration and Courage!

reviewText: Lindsay Wagner has always been one of my favorite actresses, all the way back to her days on The Bionic Woman, thankfully through later projects, she was given the chance to show her enormous acting ability and range. It is disturbing to watch, it is about domestic violence, kids are involved, co-dependent, battered wife who is afraid to leave her comfortable lifestyle, and a classic Jekyll & Hyde husband, played superbly by Michael Nouri, you may remember him most, from "Flashdance", he also has shown his great ability as an actor these past couple decades and has enormous range as well. I am satisfied, it was well worth the purchase, would definitely recommend it.

reviewText: I give this a 3-1/2 star because of the excellent acting by Lindsay Wagner, and really all of the actors. Also, the theme of spouse abuse was presented quite accurately, at least for many cases where the wife continues for years to believe that all will be better and her husband is finally changed and will never again hurt her, as he promises repeatedly. Add to that, self-esteem issues on the woman's part, desperately wanting and needing his love and admiration. Of course, personally, I ask the question why would she have 4 children? But, again, that is often how the illusion works in these kind of domestic situations.  I liked the way the movie covered many years over time and depicted changes in her as she matured and began to find herself (always a threat to the spouse abuse types).

reviewText: I never did see this movie on CBS in May 1990. But I'm thankful to have watched it on DVD. It was sad to see domestic violence, considering I personally grew up with it. The scene where John asked Charlotte to fix him some eggs is evident of John's control. The bathtub scene is a tearjerker. All in all, it describes how violence in the home affects everyone in the community.

reviewText: Very good story line, excellent acting. The plight of spousal abuse and how it played out in this particular film was very well performed. Also, since the story was based on true events made it even more enjoyable. The tape when it arrived was new and in excellent condition.

reviewText: Although this is a 1990's movie about spousal abuse, the subject matter is still very relevent today and continues to be a very serious problem.  This kind of abuse is now out in the open, but it is still hard for women to leave the situation due to children, family, lack of money, and fear.  Shattered Dreams was very well done.  Lindsay Wagner and Michael Nouri were excellent.

reviewText: I like non-fiction movies.  There are many that deal with domestic abuse & most of them are well done.  It's actually a sad statement of our times that there is no shortage of real-life material for such movies.The two main actors in this movie did an excellent job portraying their true-life characters, especially Michael Nouri - who played the abusive husband exceptionally well.  While watching the movie, there were several moments when I wanted to yell at Lindsay Wagner's character & say something like, "You Idiot" which means she played her role well.  There were other moments when Ms. Wagner's character consulted a priest for "guidance" when I wished something heavy would fall on the priest - like when he suggested she "Go home & love this man & look to the heavens for guidance" after he'd already beaten her severely several times.  I've known women who were recipients of the same idiotic advice from priests...and also the scars that result from it.I'll never completely understand why a woman's self esteem can be so low that they choose an abusive wound-up spring for a boyfriend or husband.
Title: N/A
